AcrCustomerPartner.description: Metadata about a customer partner in a collaboration

abilities.description: The list of abilities the customer partner can have in a collaboration.

configuredAdvertiserTypes.description: The type of ad configured for this advertiser

id.description: Depending on the value for advertiserType, this contains the CFID of a DSP, entity Id for a Sponsored Ads, or advertiser Id for a SAS advertiser.

marketplaceId.description: For Sponsored Ads and SAS advertisers, this contains the corresponding marketplaceId, for DSP advertisers this will be null.

name.description: Depending on the value for advertiserType, this contains either the DSP, Sponsored Ads, or SAS advertiser name.

id.description: Depending on the value for advertiserType, this contains the CFID of a DSP, entity Id for a Sponsored Ads, or advertiser Id for a SAS advertiser.

marketplaceId.description: For Sponsored Ads and SAS advertisers, this contains the corresponding marketplaceId. This will be null for DSP advertisers.

advertisersToAdd.description: List of advertiser identifiers to be added to the instance.

advertisersToRemove.description: List of advertiser identifiers to be deleted from the instance

updateId.description: Identifier of the advertiser update request. It's numeric and increasing from each request
Identifier of the advertiser update request. It's numeric and increasing from each request

AmcAdvertiserUpdateStatus.description: The status of an advertiser update request.

advertisersToAdd.description: List of advertiser identifiers. This is the list of advertisers which should be added for the given instance.

advertisersToRemove.description: List of advertiser identifiers. This is the list of advertisers which should be deleted for the given instance.

acrBacked.description: Boolean flag to indicate whether the instance will be a collaboration instance (leveraging AWS Clean Rooms). Set to 'True' for a collaboration instance.

acrCustomerPartners.description: The list of customer partners that will be added to the collaboration in an instance backed by AWS Clean Rooms (ACR).

advertiserName.description: The advertiser name associated with the AMC instance. Only numbers, english letters and spaces are allowed and size between 3 and 50 characters

awsAccountId.description: Customer-owned AWS account ID associated with the AMC instance from which the customer will upload data. It is optional and only required if the customer will be uploading data. It can be changed at a later time.

idempotencyToken.description: Optional token used to signal that the create operation should be idempotent. If supplied, subsequent requests with the same token and request parameters will produce the same results as the initial request. The size of the token should be between 1 and 36 characters. The token will be expired in 10 minutes after creation

instanceName.description: Human-readable AMC instance identifier. Only numbers, english letters and spaces are allowed and size between 3 and 50 characters

s3BucketName.description: The name of the S3 bucket associated with the AMC instance. This bucket will contain reporting workflow output.

AmcDeleteInstanceResponse.description: Empty response object denoting successful deletion of an instance.

nextToken.description: Optional. Token to use in subsequent request to retrieve next page of results. Null if all results have been returned.

advertiserName.description: The advertiser name associated with the AMC instance.

awsAccountId.description: The 12-digit AWS account ID which owns the S3 bucket associated with the instance.

s3BucketName.description: The name of the S3 bucket associated with the AMC instance. This bucket will contain reporting workflow output.

AmcpLinkForbiddenRequestExceptionRespons.description: Forbidden. The request failed because the user does not have access to the specified resource.

nextToken.description: Optional. Token to use in subsequent request to retrieve next page of results. Null if all results have been returned.

AmcpLinkServerExceptionResponseContent.description: Internal server error. Retry later. Contact support if this response persists.

AmcpLinkTooManyRequestsExceptionResponse.description: Too Many Requests. The request was rate-limited. Retry later.

AmcpLinkUnauthorizedRequestExceptionResp.description: Unauthorized. The request failed because the user is not authenticated or is not allowed to invoke the operation.

CollaborationIdMappingJob.description: Metadata about the ID mapping job associated to an ID mapping table in the collaboration.

endTime.description: The time the job execution ended.

errorDetails.description: If the job failed, contains information about the error.

startTime.description: The time the job execution started.

totalMappedSourceRecords.description: Total number of mapped records from the SOURCE.

totalMappedTargetRecords.description: Total number of mapped records from the TARGET.

uniqueRecordsLoaded.description: Total number of unique mapped records.

CollaborationIdMappingJobStatus.description: The status a job can be in.

CollaborationIdMappingJobSummary.description: Summarized metadata of the ID mapping job associated to an ID mapping table in the collaboration.

endTime.description: The time the job execution ended.

startTime.description: The time the job execution started.

CollaborationIdMappingTable.description: Metadata about a collaboration ID mapping table

queryable.description: Indicates if the table is queryable.

sourceAwsAccount.description: The AWS account ID of the input SOURCE of the ID mapping table. The SOURCE is always the member who requested the creation of the table in AMC. This field is set only for ID mapping tables created via AMC APIs.

updateTime.description: Last time the table was updated.

workflowArn.description: The ARN of the id mapping workflow processing the data backing the table.

CollaborationIdNamespaceAssociation.description: Metadata of the Id Namespace associated to the ACR collaboration

createTime.description: The time when the association was created.

creatorAccountId.description: The AWS account of the member that associated the ID namespace to the collaboration.

id.description: Uniquely identifies the association between ID namespace and collaboration.

updateTime.description: The last time the association was updated.

membershipId.description: Unique identifier of the member's membership in the collaboration.

status.description: The current status of the member in the collaboration.

amcDataProviders.description: The list of AMC managed members who contribute data in the collaboration.

customerAcceptanceLink.description: Deep link to the collaboration acceptance page in the customer's AWS account.

customerPartners.description: The list of customer partners who contribute data in the collaboration.

resultsReceivers.description: The list of members that are results receivers in the collaboration.

status.description: The current status of the collaboration.

CreateCollaborationIdMappingTablePayload.description: Input data to create an ID mapping table

collaborationId.description: Unique identifier of the collaboration the ID mapping table is part of.

idMappingWorkflowJobId.description: Unique identifier of the job started to populate the id mapping table. If AMC was not able to start the job, this field will be null and a tracking ID will be provided in the attribute queueTrackingId.

trackingId.description: Unique identifier of a job tracking token in AMC. When this attribute is not null, it indicates an idMappingWorkflowJobId is not available at the time of the response. This identifier can be used to retrieve the idMappingWorkflowJobId at a later time when it is available.

code.description: The HTTP status code of the response.

details.description: A human-readable description of the response.

idMappingJobId.description: Unique identifier of the ID mapping workflow job linked to the tracking ID provided in the request.

advertisers.description: List of advertisers added to the AMC instance. Currently supported advertiser types include DSP advertisers and Sponsored Ads advertisers (entities).

nextToken.description: Token to use in subsequent request to retrieve next page of results. Null if all results have been returned.

totalCount.description: Total number of advertisers with the specified advertiser type in this instance

advertiserTypes.description: The set of advertiser types currently associated to this instance.

apiEndpoint.description: The API URL for access the AMC reporting and Data Upload API. Each AMC instance has a unique API URL.

awsAccountId.description: The 12-digit AWS account ID which owns the S3 bucket associated with the instance.

creationDatetime.description: The date time string corresponding to the creation of the AMC instance in UTC. Format is yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'.

creationStatus.description:
The creation status of an AMC instance. The following table lists available statuses:

|Status Name|Description|
|-----------|-----------|
|REQUESTED|Instance creation is successfully requested.|
|SUBMITTED|Instance creation is submitted for processing.|
|IN_PROGRESS|Instance creation is in progress.|
|SUCCEEDED|This field is deprecated, use COMPLETED instead.|
|COMPLETED|Instance creation is complete.|
|FAILED|Instance creation failed.|

customerCanonicalName.description: Name of advertiser associated with the AMC instance.

dataUploadAwsAccountId.description: This AWS account ID is generated by Amazon for each AMC instance. It allows AMC users to grant an AMC instance permission to read data files from an S3 bucket(s). For more info on AMC Data Upload and setting up permissions on an owned S3 bucket, visit https://advertising.amazon.com/API/docs/en-us/guides/amazon-marketing-cloud/advertiser-data-upload/advertiser-data-s3-bucket. This is not the ID of the customer linked AWS account.

entities.description: The Amazon Advertising entities associated with this AMC instance.

s3BucketName.description: The name of the S3 bucket associated with the AMC instance. This bucket will contain reporting workflow output.

s3BucketRegion.description: The AWS region of the S3 bucket associated with the AMC instance.

awsAccountId.description: The identifier of the customer's AWS account.

bucketName.description: The name of the S3 bucket in the customer's AWS account.

maxResults.description: Optional. Maximum number of results to retrieve in a single API call.

nextToken.description: Optional. The pagination token from the previous API call.

idMappingTableId.description: Unique identifier of the id mapping table the jobs are associated to.

nextToken.description: The pagination token from the previous API call.

maxResults.description: Optional. Maximum number of results to retrieve in a single API call.

nextToken.description: Optional. The pagination token from the previous API call.

collaborationId.description: Unique identifier of the collaboration the ID mapping tables are associated to.

idMappingTables.description: The list of id mapping tables.

nextToken.description: The pagination token from the previous API call.

maxResults.description: Optional (not used). Maximum number of results to retrieve in a single API call. This API will always use the default value.

nextToken.description: Optional. The pagination token from the previous API call.

collaborationId.description: Unique identifier of the collaboration the ID namespaces are associated to.

collaborationIdNamespaceAssociations.description: The list of ID namespaces associated to the collaboration.

nextToken.description: The pagination token from the previous API call.
Optional. Token to use in subsequent request to retrieve next page of results. Null if all results have been returned.

collaborationId.description: Unique identifier of the collaboration the id mapping table belongs to.

idMappingWorkflowJobId.description: Unique identifier of the job started to refresh the id mapping table. If AMC was not able to start the job, this field will be null and a tracking ID will be provided in the attribute queueTrackingId.

trackingId.description: Unique identifier of a job tracking token in AMC. When this attribute is not null, it indicates an idMappingWorkflowJobId is not available at the time of the response. This identifier can be used to retrieve the idMappingWorkflowJobId at a later time when it is available.

cfnBucketUrl.description: The CloudFormation link to create the S3 bucket in the customer's AWS account.

info.description: This set of APIs allow developers to manage their Amazon Marketing Cloud accounts and instances.
info.title: AMC Administration

get.description:
Get a list of AMC Accounts that the user have access to.

**Requires one of these permissions**:
[]

parameters.description: Optional. Token to retrieve subsequent page of results.
parameters.name: nextToken

schema.description: Optional. Token to retrieve subsequent page of results.

parameters.description: The identifier of a client associated with a "Login with Amazon" account.
parameters.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-ClientId

schema.description: The identifier of a client associated with a "Login with Amazon" account.

401.description: Unauthorized. The request failed because the user is not authenticated or is not allowed to invoke the operation.

403.description: Forbidden. The request failed because the user does not have access to the specified resource.

429.description: Too Many Requests. The request was rate-limited. Retry later.

500.description: Internal server error. Retry later. Contact support if this response persists.

get.summary: Get a list of AMC Accounts that the user have access to.

get.description: Gets information about all AMC instances that the requesting entity has access to. Information for each instance includes the name, creation status, and the entities with access to the instance.

parameters.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-Scope

parameters.description: Optional. Token to retrieve subsequent page of results.
parameters.name: nextToken

parameters.description: Optional. Limits the number of items to return in the response. Max value is 100. Defaults to 100.
parameters.name: limit
